arm_group.description: Infrared and Red absorbance measurement on chest

brief_summary.textblock:
A clinical study designed to  determine the accuracy of the SpO2 function of the Vital Signs
      Patch device for measuring blood saturation level.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of SpO2: Vital Signs Patch

detailed_description.textblock:
The clinical study protocol was designed  for  determining the accuracy of the SpO2 function
      of the Vital Signs Patch device for measuring blood oxygen saturation level,  according to
      the guidelines for "evaluating and documenting SpO2 accuracy in human subjects" as set out
      in Annex EE of ISO 80601-2-61. Section 4.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Ages 23 to 33.

          -  Skin tone varied from light to dark.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Smokers

          -  Anemic

facility.name: University of California, Room M454, Moffitt Hospital, Box 0542, UCSF,

clinical_study.official_title: Pulse Oximeter Response TO Multiple Levels Of Stable Hypoxia

primary_outcome.description: Infrared and red light absorbency was measured and used for SpO2 percentage calculation

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
